translated: The bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva, free from lack of faith and doubt, should explain how, even while revolving in cyclic existence, he does not degenerate.‚Äù

translated: The different ways are the ways of thinking of the worldly ones, the ≈õrƒÅvakas, and the bodhisattvas, which will be explained below.

analyzed: kun rdzob tu chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu'i rang bzhin du mnyam pa nyid du zhugs pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'jug pa zhes pa ni /

analyzed: thabs dang shes rab yongs su zin pa zhes pa ni gong du bshad zin to //

analyzed: kyi bslab pa dang mnyam par mi 'gyur ro zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the same as the training of the worldly, the Sravakas, and the Bodhisattvas.

original: de lta bas na gsang ba'i bdag po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis shes rab dang thabs yongs su zin pa bzhin du chos thams cad la nan tan bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na gsang ba'i bdag po byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis shes rab dang thabs yongs su zin pa bzhin du chos thams cad la nan tan bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, O Lord of Secrets, the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas should practice all dharmas in the same way that they are fully endowed with wisdom and means.

analyzed: gong du bshad pa rnams bsdus pa'i tshig ste /

analyzed: shes rab dang thabs su ldan pa'i tshul ji skad bshad pa ste /

analyzed: de lta bur chos thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It is like that, and it should be applied to all phenomena.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byams pa dang snying rje chen po'i spyan gnyis kyis sems can gyi khams la gzigs nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byams pa dang snying rje chen po'i spyan gnyis kyis sems can gyi khams la gzigs nas /

analyzed: phyag na rdo rje byang chub sems dpa' la bka' stsal pa zhes pa ni /

analyzed: byams pa ni sems can thams cad bde bar 'jog pa snying rje'i sdug bsngal ba las bral ba'i mtshan nyid de /

analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan te byams pa ni sems can gyi khams rnams la yang bde ba la gzhag par 'os /
translated: Those very love and compassion are the eyes of the Blessed One. Love is suitable for placing the realms of sentient beings in happiness.

original: snying rje ni gang sdug bsngal ba las gzhol bar 'os pa gzigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje ni gang sdug bsngal ba las gzhol bar 'os pa gzigs pa'i phyir /

analyzed: skabs gzhan du phyag na rdo rje gsang ba'i bdag po zhes smos pas /

analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsams bzhin du srog gcod pa rab tu spang par bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas should completely avoid intentionally killing living beings.

analyzed: 'dul ba la sogs pa'i gzhung las ji skad du grags pa rnams lnga dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid spang bar bya'o //
translated: This means that they should avoid killing that possesses the characteristics of the five aspects of killing that are well known from the scriptures on discipline and so forth.

original: dbyug pa spang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //

analyzed: zhes pa skad cig ma phyi ma'i shes rab kyis snying po dang bcas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rtse gcig tu rtogs pa'i tshe gong du bshad pa'i tshul du snying po de'i 'od 'phros 'dus pa las rang gi gzugs kun du sangs rgyas pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid
translated: When the wisdom of the subsequent moment realizes the essence and the moon mandala one-pointedly, as explained above, light radiates from that essence and returns, transforming one‚Äôs form into the characteristics of the enlightened body.üîΩ

original: du gyur par mthong ba zhes ba'o //
analyzed: du gyur par mthong ba zhes ba'o //

original: de bas na gsungs @242a * //
analyzed: de bas na gsungs @242a * //

original: pa lus la lus kyi gzugs su zhes pa ste bdag gi lus la bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i gzugs su bya'o zhes pa ste de'i phyi rol gyi lus sangs rgyas kyi skur bsam pa'i thabs so //

analyzed: yid las byung ngo zhes pa ni bdag gi yid las byung ba'i me long gi dkyil 'khor snying po dang bcas pa bsam zhes pa ste /

original: de na dag pa 'byung ba ni rang gi bzang po ste zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gnyis ka de ltar bsgoms na phyi'i lus kun sangs rgyas pa'i skur mdzes par dag par 'gyur ba dang / nang gi yid la yang snying po dang bcas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gsal zhing dag pa'i phyir skur bsam pa'i bdag gi lus dang nang gi snying por bsam pa'i bdag gi las byas pa las dag pa de dag kyang 'byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de na dag pa 'byung ba ni rang gi bzang po ste zhes pa ni phyi dang nang gnyis ka de ltar bsgoms na phyi'i lus kun sangs rgyas pa'i skur mdzes par dag par 'gyur ba dang / nang gi yid la yang snying po dang bcas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gsal zhing dag pa'i phyir skur bsam pa'i bdag gi lus dang nang gi snying por bsam pa'i bdag gi las byas pa las dag pa de dag kyang 'byung zhes pa'o //
translated: When one meditates on both the external and internal in that way, the external body becomes pure and beautiful as the Buddha's body, and the internal mind becomes clear and pure as the moon mandala with its essence. Therefore, one imagines the body as the Buddha's body and imagines one's own action as the essence inside. Those purities also arise.

original: dag pa zhes pa yang skabs 'dir ye shes la sogs pa dag pa'i mtshan nyid la mi bya'i /

analyzed: de bzhin dag ba mthong ba dang // zhes pa ni kun du sangs rgyas pa'i skur @242b 'gyur ba'i rig 'dzin te /

analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa'i sgo nas bstan pa ste /

analyzed: bdag gi lus la kun du sangs rgyas pa'i skur bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'o //

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'dra bar gzhan cung zad med do zhes pa ni /

analyzed: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i sku la shin tu zhes pa'i phyir gsungs pa ste /

original: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i sku las khyad par 'phags shing gzhan dag gi sku yang med pas na kun du sangs rgyas pa'i sku 'di nyid rang gi lus la bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'o //

analyzed: med pa la ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ji ltar bdag gi mig dang rna ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: de dag kyang rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes pa ni @243a * //

analyzed: mig dang rna ba la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhir gtogs pa'i chos de dag thog ma nas ma byung ma skyes pa'am /

original: rdul phran phyogs dang cha la sogs pa bshig na /
analyzed: rdul phran phyogs dang cha la sogs pa bshig na /

analyzed: de dag rang bzhin yod par mi 'grub ces pa'o //

analyzed: ming tsam gyis zin pa zhes pa ni dngos po stong pa ste ming du gdags pa tsam zhes pa'o //

analyzed: dngos po med na yang ming du gdags pa ji ltar yod ce na gsungs pa nam mkha' dang 'dra zhes pa nam mkha' yang med mod kyi /
translated: If there are no entities, how can there be designations of names?üîΩThe answer is that they are like space.

analyzed: nam mkha' zhes pa'i ming du brjod do //

original: de bzhin du 'di dag kyang dngos po med mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di dag kyang dngos po med mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, these things do not exist,

analyzed: mig dang rna ba zhes ming tsam du brjod do //

analyzed: gzugs med pa'o zhes pa ni de ltar de dag rang bzhin gyis stong pa bas gang gis gzung ba'i cham yin no zhes pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú They are formless‚Äù means that, since they are empty of intrinsic nature, they are the objects of apprehension.

analyzed: tshig de dag gis mig la sogs pa'i dngos po de rnams stong pa'i rang bzhin nam mkha' ltar bstan pa'o //
translated: These words show that those things, such as the eye, are empty by nature, like space.

original: las dang rgyu las byung zhes pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: las dang rgyu las byung zhes pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su bstan pa ste /

analyzed: rgyu ma rig pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'o //

analyzed: las ni 'phral gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi spyod pa ste /
translated: The karma is the present virtuous and nonvirtuous, etc., conduct of the three doors of body, speech, and mind.

analyzed: don dam par de dag dngos po med kyang kun rdzob tu las dang rgyu las skyes par snang ngo zhes pa'o //

analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu snang ba yang gzugs brnyan ltar ma brtags pa'i sgo nas snang bar zad kyi /

analyzed: gzugs brnyan de rigs pa dang gzhung gi sgo nas brtags pa dang / brtag mi bzod de yod par mi 'grub pa bzhin no zhes pa'o //
translated: When those reflections are analyzed through reasoning and scripture, they cannot withstand analysis, and thus they are not established as existent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe TathƒÅgata has realized‚Äù means that

analyzed: chos de rnams sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang 'di lta bu'i tshul du mngon par mkhyen to zhes pa'o //

original: de dag kyang phan tshun rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyun mi 'chad par so sor zin pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang phan tshun rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyun mi 'chad par so sor zin pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are uninterruptedly engaged in mutual dependent origination‚Äù means that

original: gang du gzugs brnyan dang 'dra zhes pa la gal te de ltar gzugs brnyan dang 'dra na /üîΩgzugs brnyan ni gzugs med na mi 'byung ba bzhin du rgyun chad dam zhe na /
analyzed: gang du gzugs brnyan dang 'dra zhes pa la gal te de ltar gzugs brnyan dang 'dra na / gzugs brnyan ni gzugs med na mi 'byung ba bzhin du rgyun chad dam zhe na /
translated: If it is like a reflection,üîΩthen just as a reflection does not occur without a form, is the continuum of afflictions severed?

original: gzugs brnyan bzhin chad pa ma yin gyi nyon mongs pa snga ma'i skad cig pa'i cha med kyang /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan bzhin chad pa ma yin gyi nyon mongs pa snga ma'i skad cig pa'i cha med kyang /
translated: It is not severed like a reflection, but although the afflictions do not have parts that are momentary,

analyzed: nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i las dang tshe dag kyang 'bras bu skyed par byed de /

analyzed: gzugs @243b brnyan ltar gzugs med na mi 'byung ba ma yin gyi /

analyzed: phan tshun rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung nga zhes pa'o //
translated: They occur in an uninterrupted continuum, mutually dependent.

original: gang rkyen las 'byung ba de ni gzugs brnyan lta bu zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang rkyen las 'byung ba de ni gzugs brnyan lta bu zhes pa ni /
translated: That which arises from conditions is like a reflection.

original: de lta bu'i rkyen las byung ba'i chos de rnams brtag mi bzod cing don dam par yod pa ma yin pa dper na gzugs brnyan dang 'dra zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rkyen las byung ba'i chos de rnams brtag mi bzod cing don dam par yod pa ma yin pa dper na gzugs brnyan dang 'dra zhes pa'o //
translated: Those phenomena that arise from such conditions cannot withstand analysis and do not ultimately exist, like a reflection.

translated: Since they arise in dependence and relation, the deity is the self, and the self is the deity. Thus, although ultimately there are no phenomena, conventionally phenomena appear from dependent origination.

analyzed: bdag gi rkyen gyis lha bskyed lha'i rkyen gyis bdag bskyed pa bas bdag bskyed do zhes pa'o //

analyzed: gang dus gsum med cing rang bzhin gyis stong pa de ni de bzhin nyid kyi mtshan nyid rnam par mi rtog pas mtshan ma 'byung ba ma yin par rig par byas nas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: That which is beyond the three times and empty of a nature is the nonconceptual suchness. Knowing that signs do not arise, one should abide in signless samadhi.

original: gzhan yang gsang ba'i bdag po yid ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o zhes byis pa so so'i 'gro ba @255b rnams rtog pa yang dag pa ma yin par kun du brtags pa'i tshig bla dags par ni mi shes so zhes pa ni yid las mtshan ma mi 'byungüîΩba'i rtog pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gsang ba'i bdag po yid ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o zhes byis pa so so'i 'gro ba @255b rnams rtog pa yang dag pa ma yin par kun du brtags pa'i tshig bla dags par ni mi shes so zhes pa ni yid las mtshan ma mi 'byung ba'i rtog pa bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the conception that signs do not arise from the mind.

original: mig la sogs pa'i sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa ji bzhin par snang bar 'byung ba ni byis pa rnams kyis 'khrul par rtogs pa ste /üîΩbyis pa de rnams kyis ni 'khrul pa yin par mi shes so zhes pa gang yang dag par ma yin pa de ni ma skyes pa'o zhes pa'i gong du sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa de yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas de yang don dam
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa gzugs la sogs pa ji bzhin par snang bar 'byung ba ni byis pa rnams kyis 'khrul par rtogs pa ste / byis pa de rnams kyis ni 'khrul pa yin par mi shes so zhes pa gang yang dag par ma yin pa de ni ma skyes pa'o zhes pa'i gong du sgo drug gi rnam par shes pa de yang dag par yod pa ma yin pas de yang don dam
translated: The consciousnesses of the six sense doors such as the eyes arise as the appearances of forms and so on, which are realized to be mistaken by childish beings.üîΩThose childish beings do not know that they are mistaken.üîΩThat which is not real is unarisen.

original: pa'i mtshan ma 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i mtshan ma 'byung ba'i rgyu ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The consciousnesses of the six sense doors do not exist in reality, and therefore they are not the cause for the arising of ultimate signs.

original: de ltar bsams na gsang ba'i bdag po sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob bo zhes pa ni ji ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i lhar bdag gi lus bsgyur ba na /
analyzed: de ltar bsams na gsang ba'i bdag po sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mtshan med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob bo zhes pa ni ji ltar yongs su ma dag pa'i lhar bdag gi lus bsgyur ba na /
translated: Thus, O Lord of Secrets, the bodhisattva who practices the bodhisattva deeds in the door of mantra, having attained the signless meditative stabilization,üîΩjust as he transforms his body into a deity of impure appearance and shape,

original: lha de'i kha dog dang dang dbyibs ci 'dra bar bsgyur ba bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i lha'i rang bzhin du bsgyur ba yang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs na yongs su dag pa'i lha'i rang bzhin du bsgyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lha de'i kha dog dang dang dbyibs ci 'dra bar bsgyur ba bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i lha'i rang bzhin du bsgyur ba yang mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs na yongs su dag pa'i lha'i rang bzhin du bsgyur ba ma yin te /
translated: when he transforms into the nature of a pure deity of signlessness, he does not transform into the nature of a pure deity when he enters the signless meditative stabilization.

analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob po zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i lha'i rang bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //

analyzed: nam mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas par gyur pa de ni gsang ba'i bdag po de la de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i sngags mngon du phyogs par gnas so zhes pa ni nam yongs su dag pa'i lha'i rang bzhin la gnas na de bzhin gshegs
translated: When one abides in the meditative stabilization of signlessness, then, O Lord of Secrets, one abides facing the mantras taught by the TathƒÅgatas.

analyzed: pas gsungs pa'i thabs kyis lha rnams 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that when one abides in the nature of the completely pure deity, then the deities taught by the TathƒÅgatas will be accomplished by means of the method.

analyzed: de la gzhol ba zhes pa ni sngags pa de la lha de rnams gzhol lo zhes pa'o //

original: gzhan yang gas pa'i dag po bzlas pa bshad do zhes pa la sogs pa ni bzlas pa'i de kho na nyid kyi le'u bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gas pa'i dag po bzlas pa bshad do zhes pa la sogs pa ni bzlas pa'i de kho na nyid kyi le'u bshad pa ste /

original: bzlas pa de yang lha'i sbyor ba rnam par gnyis la gnas nas bzlas pa ni gong du yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i lha'i rang bzhin bshad pa la gnas na ste /

analyzed: de yang yongs su ma dag pa'i lha'i rang bzhin la gnas nas bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhir ldan pa ni sngar yang bshad zin te /

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa ni nang gi mtshan ma med pa'i bzlas pa'i 'dir bshad pa dang / @256a * //

analyzed: de la gcig gis gcig tu zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa'i lha'i sbyor ba gcig la gnas nas yid kyis bzlas pa gcig pu bya'o zhes pa'o //

analyzed: gcig pu yang na gcig gis so zhes pa ni yongs su ma dag pa ni lha'i sbyor bas yid kyis bzlas pa bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Alone or by one‚Äù means that, in the case of an impure deity, one should perform the mental recitation by means of the yoga of the deity.

original: rang thos rnam pa gnyis kyis bya'o zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i lha'i sbyor ba gnyis kas rang thos kyi bzlas pa bya'o zhes pa ste de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang thos rnam pa gnyis kyis bya'o zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i lha'i sbyor ba gnyis kas rang thos kyi bzlas pa bya'o zhes pa ste de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: ‚Äú One should perform the recitation of one‚Äôs own hearing by means of both‚Äù means that, by means of both the yoga of a completely pure deity and the yoga of an impure deity, one should perform the recitation of one‚Äôs own hearing.üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: rtag tu sbyor mchog gnyis su bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sbyor mchog gnyis su bya'o //
translated: One should always apply oneself to the two supreme yogas.

original: zhes pa ste yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'i lha'i sbyor ba la rtag tu brtson par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste yongs su dag pa dang yongs su ma dag pa'i lha'i sbyor ba la rtag tu brtson par bya'o zhes pa'o //

analyzed: bzlas pa gzhan du mi bya'o //

analyzed: yan lag 'gal bar sngags mkhan gyis //

translated: This means that one should not recite in a way that is contrary to the ritual of recitation or that lacks the complete limbs, other than these two, the outer and inner four-limbed recitation and the inner ultimate recitation.

analyzed: phyi dang nang gi sbyor bas su //
translated: By the outer and inner yogas,

analyzed: yan lag bzhi ru ngas bshad pa //

analyzed: de yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i bzlas pa'i nang nas mchog go zhes pa'o //

analyzed: zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //

original: lha la song ba'i yid kyis so //
analyzed: lha la song ba'i yid kyis so //

analyzed: zhes pa ni 'di la sems rtse gcig tu dmigs par bya'o zhes pa'o //

analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pa'i yid kyis bya'o //

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to

analyzed: gzhan du bar ni bshad pa med //

original: de la slar sdud pa'i rnam pa spangs zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bzlas pa de yongs su ma dag pa'i lha'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pas phyi rol gyi bzlas pa'i yan lag las nang gi yan lag tu bsdu ba med do zhes pa'o //

translated: The phrase abandoning the aspect of re-collection means that since the supramundane repetition does not perceive the nature of the impure deity, it is not the case that it is included in the inner branch from the outer branch of repetition.

analyzed: tha dad ma yin par ni gzung //

analyzed: lha dang bdag gnyis tha mi dad par bya'o zhes pa'o //

original: de las gsal bar gsungs pa /

original: yid la rang bzhin 'byed med par //
analyzed: yid la rang bzhin 'byed med par //

analyzed: gzhan du bshad pa ma yin no //
